column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Numbers dropped by 166 for a yarding of 1046 cattle. Quality was good with feeder weights the best supplied and good supplyâ€™s of heavy prime grown cattle along with limited numbers of cows. All the regular buyers were present.

Prime yearling steers gained 2c, selling from 300c to to 345c, while prime yearling heifers lifted 15c, 250c to 338c/kg. Feeder steers were firm to slightly cheaper selling form 288c to 360c, and feeder heifers were 10c cheaper, 243c to 320c/kg.

Prime grown steers were down 5c, 250c to 347c, while prime grown heifers were firm to dearer, 250c to 338c/kg. Cows fell 20c, 2 and 3 scores sold from 180c to 268c, and heavy prime cows, 267c to 277c/kg. Heavy bulls sold to 290c/kg.

Market reporter, Angus Williams.
